intro: Scholtzia laxiflora, commonly known as the slender-flowered scholtzia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, with ray florets that are shorter than the central disk florets. Scholtzia laxiflora is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and chaparral.
